name: Mohit Jeswani
about: Building Software Defined Data Center for Azure cloud.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: * Modified Host selection logic which is being used in creating New Software Defined Data Center, Adding host/Clusters in Single pod and multi-pod SDDC.* Enabled Just Enough Access for vCenter.* Created Jump Servers for single pod software defined data center.* Enable Monitoring for VM.* Migration of Base Image CI Pipeline.
experience.description_html: * Modified Host selection logic which is being used in creating New Software Defined Data Center, Adding host/Clusters in Single pod and multi-pod SDDC.* Enabled Just Enough Access for vCenter.* Created Jump Servers for single pod software defined data center.* Enable Monitoring for VM.* Migration of Base Image CI Pipeline. <!---->

experience.title: Engineer
experience.description: I was part of the Linux kernel Team, Where my primary responsibility was to Automate the test cases for Bootloader and Base port part of Linux kernel.
experience.description_html: I was part of the Linux kernel Team, Where my primary responsibility was to Automate the test cases for Bootloader and Base port part of Linux kernel. <!---->

experience.title: Data Science Intern
experience.description: 1. Quantitative analysis models for mutual fund research:A). Collected historical and monthly data of Attribution, liquidity, and various benchmark dependent and independent parameters(Alpha, Beta, Return, Up Capture ratio, etc.) of Mutual Funds in different currencies from Morning Star, FactSet.B). All this data comes into multiple excel files. After preprocessing, Built database schemaand upload all data into SQL Server. After that, We integrated SQL Server from Tableauand built the necessary dashboards.C). This project is used by the team for Mutual Fund analysis.2. TER Analysis:A). Collected data from data sources, consolidated it and did outlier detection by usingDBSCAN, Local outlier Factor, Isolation forest techniques.Tools Used: Python, MS SQL Server, Tableau.
experience.description_html: 1. Quantitative analysis models for mutual fund research:A). Collected historical and monthly data of Attribution, liquidity, and various benchmark dependent and independent parameters(Alpha, Beta, Return, Up Capture ratio, etc.) of Mutual Funds in different currencies from Morning Star, FactSet.B).
